website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight and durable option that works well on all surfaces, even sand.
pros: Made of corrosion-resistant aluminum, with 10-inch pneumatic tires
cons: Some had problems keeping the kayak or canoe from slipping off this trolley when the boat was wet
The included strap is too short to work with most boats

customer_reviews.title: How to USE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Once I was shown how to use it, was great! Just didn’t come with instructions. Hopefully this video will help future buyers!
customer_reviews.author: melissa kissick

customer_reviews.title: No need to wait for someone to help load my canoe.
customer_reviews.text: This little mule is built tough and light weight. Good quality and great price. I’ve used it in sand, mud and rocks.
customer_reviews.author: FigJohn

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We use them for transporting our kayaks. After transporting them to the water we take off the wheels and put the unit in the Kayak. Wheels are very easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT HAVE SOLID TIRES!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ***DESCRIPTION IS WRONG!!!!***** This DOES have pnuematic tires.......NOT solid rubber tires as is stated. Even says so on the included instruction sheet!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis & April

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to fold up and store.
customer_reviews.text: Oxford folding kayak dolly is perfect for transporting my 12 ft.. Kayak to the beach and into the gulf. Light weight and sturdy for easy rolling on sand.
customer_reviews.author: scott h bailey

customer_reviews.title: It made my kayak feel like it weighed nothing
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put my 13 foot kayak on this dolly I knew what I was missing. For a cheap Kayak dolly this gets the job done. It made my kayak feel like it weighed nothing. Yes, the tires send out an overwhelmingly smell new rubber. Let it air outside for a day after you take it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Elenor Macgregor

customer_reviews.title: I think the one with the bars that fit into holes in bottom of your kayak will work better for me
customer_reviews.text: This just didn't work for me with my kayak. I have a 9.5 foot sit on top but it was just too difficult to center and then strapping it on didn't quite work, it just slipped right off the straps. I think the one with the bars that fit into holes in bottom of your kayak will work better for me, a little more expensive but a friend has one and says it's way easier.
customer_reviews.author: maggien

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, better if you have two people to use it.
customer_reviews.text: We got this to help move my kayak which weighs 85 pounds. The first time we used it, it worked pretty good but I had my wife help me with it. When I tried to use it by myself the kayak fell off of it twice and it was a lot harder to use without help. I didn’t strap it in because of how it sits in the rack. I’m sure it would work better for smaller kayaks, mine is twelve foot long as well.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing this trolly for a long time and love this model. It is so easy to put my kayak right on it and wheel it down the hill to the river. And then it folds up easily to fit in my car. It is sturdy and rugged to go over grass or rocks. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: PegCot

customer_reviews.title: Not Airless Solid Rubber Tires
customer_reviews.text: We chose this product & ordered 2 because we did not want to mess with tubes or air pumps. The tires are NOT "airless, solid rubber" as in the product description. They most definitely have valves & need air...30lbs PSI. After contacting the seller & simply requesting the "airless solid rubber tires" (which they could not or would not provide) we decided to keep the dolly's as we needed them that weekend. The seller did compensate us, but they have not changed the product description as requested. With that said...they are light & worked fine but we haven't had to haul our kayaks very far on rough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: CycleAway

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable and easy to use. I love it. It is affordable compared to the cost to make my DIY kayak cart but my homemade kayak cart was easy broken. That's why I bought this. Besides affordable cost, this cart is good to carry my kayak and it can be fold to store on my kayak when I row
customer_reviews.author: Tom EG

customer_reviews.title: Relevantly light easy to operate and carry
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute well designed trolley. Relevantly light easy to operate and carry. I purchased one a year ago and now have two of them since i need two for both ends of my heavy kayak. I prefer this product because of its light weight. This product meets it immediate design intent well.
customer_reviews.author: Obscura-01

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I really like this carrier. It has made moving my 88lb tandem kayak so much easier. I can even use it all by myself so that my wife can focus on wrangling the dogs getting from the car to the water. The issue from the beginning was that we did not use a strap. This is a must and solved all my problems. READ THE INSTRUCTIONS and you will be fine :) This is very light and easy to remove the wheels in case we do not have enough room in the car. Other carriers are twice as much but this does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Better than a DIY for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this thing was much sturdier than I expected. I was looking into diy solutions because I didn't want to pay the price tag on other carts that were in upwards of $80 to $100 bucks. And with the price of this thing it's much better than anything you could build for $25 bucks. It's worth it. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Fish Dude

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Kept Sliding Off
customer_reviews.text: I watched the video and tried to secure my 10'foot kayak to this trolley but after pulling it two feet, the kayak would slide off. Asked my neighbors for help thinking I may be doing it wrong, but the same result happened when they secured my kayak to this trolley. Purchased the Suspenz XL Airless End Cart in its place and it works like a dream. Cost a $100 more, but in this example, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: mwiscount

customer_reviews.title: Ordered because of airless tires, received with tube tires that require air
customer_reviews.text: Specifically ordered because it stated airless tires. Item I received had tube tires that required air. Update: Seller has started texting my cell phone offering free product for a positive review. You should avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: kajoiner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Based on some reviews I was expecting my garage to smell like a tire shop. Not the case at all. Yes, it smells like rubber...because it's rubber. Not overpowering though. Works well, definetely makes life easier. I have a 15' double pointed canoe, the best way I've found to load it is to bring it a little less than halfway under the canoe and then strap it in. Any less and it gets wobbely. Use your own ratchet straps if you can. If not the strap included works, just not as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Manookian

customer_reviews.title: Best product for carrying my kayak
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing I am 4’11” so carrying or even dragging a kayak to the water is not feasible for me With this I am able to place my kayak in the carrier and wheel it to the lake I have used it on pavement, and uneven grassy surfaces I recommend watching a few videos on how to hook it up and placing the wheels towards the back of the kayak. This will make it easier to move and reduce the weight you are carrying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: makes moving a kayak on pavement much easier
customer_reviews.text: I had a little hiccup with the delivery (parts were missing from box). i contacted the seller and they quickly shipped an entire dolly to me. the dolly works well on paved surfaces. the dolly pads match some hull shapes better than others. I used a pool noodle to build up the dolly pads to better match my kayak hull shape. it takes some mods to use off road on broken rough ground but all in all it works well.
customer_reviews.author: mike honcho

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Transport For Your Kayak
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little kayak cart, but I was somewhat disappointed that the tires were not solid foam as the description stated. It does what it is supposed to do, which is make it much easier to get your kayak to the water from your vehicle. Once you get to the water to launch, the cart is easily folded up and strapped to the kayak to await your return to shore. It really is about everything you can ask for and I would recommend it for ease of use and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Makes light work in transporting your kayak
customer_reviews.text: I purchased The Oxford kayak dolly for my teenage son, who was battling with transporting his kayak from the car to the water. He loves it and is using his kayak more often. It is well built , folds away for easy storage when not in use, priced right and makes light work of transporting your kayak. I did upgrade the cord provided to budgee cords which really helped . The dolly is worth it
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: This dolly was a lifesaver. I’m a single woman & have to get my kayak up & down a fairly steep hill by myself to launch it into the river. It was not difficult to balance the kayak on the dolly. & it worked well going both down & up hill.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Finch

customer_reviews.title: Trolley is great, but get a better tie-down
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble but do yourself a favor and buy your own ratchet tie-down system. The tie-down that’s included is no more reliable than those twisty-ties on bread products. My kayaks kept twisting off the trolley because the tie-down loosened with every step. Once I switched the tie-down out with my own ratchet system, I was even able to mount 2 kayaks on this one trolley. Great trolley, especially off-road.
customer_reviews.author: wujtang

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION, NOT AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: !!!!!!! CAUTION, NOT AS ADVERTISED !!!!!!! These are NOT solid rubber tires, they are tube type pneumatic air filled. DO NOT BUY IF YOU WANT AIRLESS TIRES. Could have bought this type for at least $10 less. Now I've got to wait on them to respond or ship correct item. In the mean time they've got my money and Amazon was very little help. Online chat only...
customer_reviews.author: D. Sloat

customer_reviews.title: works perfect on the beach for paddleboards too!
customer_reviews.text: absolute fantastic deal! bravo! it works for my paddle board. great in deep sand and super lightweight. fantastic deal guys!
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer NY FL

customer_reviews.title: How to put it on the kayak.
customer_reviews.text: I need it to move my kayak as it is too heavy to lift on my own. This product is difficult to attach to the kayak so it will hold. Also, the item arrived with a flat tire. The inner tube had a hole in it. I tried to call customer service but was given the message that the answering machine was full. I sent a message by way of the web site but got no response. So I paid $10.00 for a new inner tube with installation. The product does work but the attachment is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne  Downs

customer_reviews.title: Beware of roots and rocks with these wheels
customer_reviews.text: Took this to use to carry my SUP and camping gear .3 miles from a parking lot down a trail to a lake. Although the wheels are plenty large the foot-stands do not have much clearance from the ground. I immediately got stuck on the first root in the trail and quickly realized these wheels were not going to be any help. I would not use these wheels on anything other than flat/smooth surfaces. They might work ok on sand.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is absolutely the best. I drag my kayak through some extreme area's, tall brush, over rocks and rubble and through the mud. I use my own tie ratchet tie down and that's the key to hold the kayak on the dolly. I'm am so happy with this dolly.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Wilsey

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak Transport
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I bought kayaks this Summer. Needed a way to transport them to the water's edge and over rough terrain. Sturdy frame and large tires make it easy to handle. You've got to determine the optimum location of the dolly in relationship to the kayak. Also, you'll need to play with the tie-down straps depending on the shape of the hull where is sits on the dolly. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Went kayaking last weekend loaded my kayak, kayak continued to fall off kickstand was hard to stay up when you’re trying to load the kayak just not as easy as I expected it was a hassle I ended up carrying the kayak and the cart
customer_reviews.author: Latoya

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!  Wrong Tires!
customer_reviews.text: The description you provided and the corresponding picture are misleading! CAPACITY: Our kayak dolly can carry up to 165 lbs. and includes a cam buckle tie down strap to secure your kayak, canoe, or another small boat once it’s been placed on top of the trolley. The dolly also features 10” all-terrain airless solid rubber tires for easy rolling along with a double leg kickstand for extra stability and easy loading. My cart arrived today and the tires have valves which means these tires require air. I purchased this just because of the airless tires. If you look at the picture of the wheel on Amazon there is no valve on the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Head Rat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Usefull
customer_reviews.text: Great delivery, came on time and as advertised. The unit is simple and easy to use, makes transport of my 17' canoe a snap! Stores easily on board, thanks for a great product! I would recommend this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kayak dolly
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome dolly for kayaks. I use it to haul an 11 foot kayak and only have ever had difficulty in deep sand. It works great in all other terrains. I also like that, upon disassembly, it fits inside the kayak with me so I dont have to walk back to the truck just to put the dolly away while we are on the water.
customer_reviews.author: broomestick

customer_reviews.title: WHEELS ARE NOT AS DESCRIBED1
customer_reviews.text: The selling point for this cart was the airless rubber tire -which they are not! Now as I read other review, I see that it has already been noted. They are PNEUMATIC TIRES!! Very dissatisfied as this product is not as described.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Dial

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for hauling surfboards
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Got it to pull a few surfboards from the parking lot across a long beach. I needed to strap them all together and then use the tie down that comes with it to help pull it. It worked okay, better than making a few trips or my kids dragging them.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: Works great once you practice using it.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little practice and thinking out on how you want to use it. But once you figure that out it works great even on sand. You will need to experiment on where to place the straps and where to position the cart on the kayak. Check out YouTube for reviews and ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Folds up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and store in the garage. The frame is very lightweight. You’ll definitely need a strap to hold it in place. Be aware that some of it is plastic and likely won’t last as long as the aluminum frame.
customer_reviews.author: kodiakcowboy

customer_reviews.title: Tie me kangaroo down
customer_reviews.text: Like trying to tie down a greased pig. No matter how you strap it down it wants to move around. I tried strapping it with the included strap,lol. Even tried two heavy straps and it still wanted to break loose. Finally just carried this 9’ kayak a couple of feet at a time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to carry
customer_reviews.text: We have a double kayak and my wife had a little difficulty when we'd carry it from the truck. The dolly made all the difference in the world. Moves well over uneven ground an makes our experience more enjoyable. It's light enough to tie into our kayak if we want to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started out good
customer_reviews.text: This started out very good, but then one day the tires were flat. The whole was near the valve stem and could not be fixed. So, I decided to find a different kayak transport. I don't think I'll use inflatable tires on a kayak transport again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pilcher

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this kayak trolley, I have a 10ft Lifetime fishing kayak that fits perfect. Dont let the price fool you, this is a quality trolley. Customer service with this vendor is A+++. So glad I didnt spend $100.00 on a different one. One person can pull a kayak with ease, even load your supplies on the kayak over the wheels or just behind the wheels . I'll be buying another for my second kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Not functional.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble but not very functional. My kayak will not stay on it no matter how I for it on. Also the two legs meant to be brakes are not effective.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in Renton

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Airless tires were advertised, but tires requiring air were sent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds and pulls well for double kayak and SUP
customer_reviews.text: I used this for both my double kayak and SUP board. It worked excellent. The ties help stabilize and should be used as mine was a 13ft. Made it a breeze to carry by double kayak on my own as a 5'0" tall woman! I stored it right on my kayak amd no problem with fold. Wheels are excellent and durable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Margarite H

customer_reviews.title: The most important investment you can make if you kayak
customer_reviews.text: It is about 3/10 of a mile to the water for my 12 foot ocean kayak and honestly until this purchase I found it impossible to transport to the water without dragging the bottom out. This device has made kayaking pleasurable again and has saved my back from lifting. Cannot say enough about this little device
customer_reviews.author: C. Corrall

customer_reviews.title: Sure it's light weight and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: But does it hold your kayak onto it? NO it does not. I end up dragging the kayak half the time. If you buy your own straps or some rope, then sure. But the junk hardware that comes with it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great little kayak dolly
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to properly use this item, it works perfectly wet or dry. I gave 5 stars because it was a little late. I contacted the seller and the replied quickly and to my satisfaction. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Kayak dolly missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: We already owned a kayak dolly but needed a second one. The new one we purchased is great. It came missing pieces--the pin that hold the wheels on. We contacted the manufacturer through amazon rerouting an email to them, and they could not send us the parts but said they would give us money back for us to buy the pieces locally. The money never came. I bought a couple of bolts with nuts that work fine. We have the most unique dolly in the world now. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Redinger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dolly for mu rowing scull when my previous dolly was stolen off the beach last week. What an improvement! This dolly is larger and very stable with the double support legs, but still light weight. The pneumatic tires easily and smoothly rolled over debris a driftwood at the beach waterline. This is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, affordable
customer_reviews.text: I have an open-top fishing kayak and most dollies or improvised things I’ve used we’re not compatible or tricky due to wheels rubbing the lateral edges of the bottom of my kayak. This dolly is well designed to prevent that problem. These specific wheels also provide a smoother transport over rough terrain vs the hard plastic wheels that other dollies have. Could use a more deliberate mount/bracket/slot for the strap to go through to keep the dolly in the ideal position, but that may be just an issue with my flatter kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Kris L

customer_reviews.title: solid & fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Old Town Topwater 106 Kayak. The underside of the Kayak has deep "grooves" shaped into he hull for stability. This Kayak Cart fits perfectly into the grooves, like it was custom made. Before you buy this caddie, look at the underside of your kayak to see that the caddie will fit the shape of your hull. I guess I got lucky. This was a snap to assemble and appears to be very solid and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tevlin Family

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wheels
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for the price. The strap that came with it is near useless. Very easy to assemble use if you have your own higher quality straps. Wheels are small and cheap. One broke within 10 uses. Frame is ok. I’ll buy bigger and better wheels at the hardware store and continue to use. Overall: If you are new to paddling and just use this to go from car to launch on pavement this will work perfectly. If you are a little more serious and will use this on uneven terrain, stay away. Eat the extra $50 and get a better quality product
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Not robust, but pretty good otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but bent with less weight than advertised, though the bending occurred during a bounce on a sidewalk crack that put some stress on it. I bent back carefully and use it with less weight (all paddles, life preservers, etc removed) and make sure I'm rolling on a smooth surface, avoiding all bumps and pavement cracks, and it's been good.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Had to return sent two different wheels and one wheel did not fit the cart
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but attachment needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy carrier, attachment to kayak leaves a lot to be desired. Comes with one strap that slides and does not stay in place causing constant readjustment.
customer_reviews.author: wiley18

customer_reviews.title: Works well on road or sand, not great on stairs.
customer_reviews.text: I expected to have to assemble the cart, but was pleased that I only had to slip on the wheels. Assembled in about a minute. The tires definitely have that "new tire" smell. It made getting our kayak/paddleboard hybrid to the beach much easier. The only downside was that the wheels were a little small to go over the stairs on the dune crossover. this was true of all the different carts I researched under $100. I feel it was a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cbuch

customer_reviews.title: Great for Families!
customer_reviews.text: These trolleys work great! We take our 3 small children kayaking with us and as you can imagine its kind of a circus getting all 3 kids and 2 kayaks down to the water. With these trolleys, we can load everything and the children on to the kayaks and roll everything at once to the water. Major time and stress saver.
customer_reviews.author: Grace T.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: FYI - the tires are not airless like they claimed to be. They are just regular tires. It was easy to assemble and hopefully it will perform well but I won't know that until May or June of 2020. If the tires do a good job of holding air and the strap holds the kayak then I could give this a 5 star rating but it is too early for that now. This was a birthday gift so that is why I bought it so far in advance of the kayaking season in Wisconsin
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why the quality has dropped
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product before and it functioned fine. Recent purchase on the same kayak and the tubing has bent in 3 places. So disappointed the product took such a nosedive. Please look elsewhere for your kayak cart needs.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Good product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Decent Kayak dolly. I would recommend a ratchet strap instead of the included one. This was sturdy enough to haul 100lbs worth of Kayak, but it was heavy. Took some getting used to to know how to strap it down. Overall good product. I recommended it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, but company stood by the product
customer_reviews.text: We received the product and it was missing parts, but the company stood by their product, which was refreshing! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: broke after one day
customer_reviews.text: not worth your time or money. Wheels fell off due to cheap hardware after first use with my canoe. only a 14 ft canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S Spatz

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use over to figure out the way the belt has to fit. Makes carrying the kayak and gear extremely simple.
customer_reviews.author: cpakk

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: the product is good quality. If you have a wide kayak or canoe it may not fit perfect. But if you strap it on right it rolls fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Nice kayak carrier,  great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service and a really nice product. My carrier arrived with a hole in the tube. It was immediately addressed by customer service. I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger g

customer_reviews.title: Sub-standard design
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible design....... Terrible. This isn't capable of holding my kayak, and as far as I can tell, nor would it be capable of carting any vessel that doesn't have a completely flat bottom. The "kickstand" is a joke. It can't even stand itself upright, let alone whilst holding a kayak. I'll have to do some serious modifications to this contraption in order to make it even remotely useful.
customer_reviews.author: James Harkins

customer_reviews.title: So much easier!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so helpful! My body just couldn't handle carrying our kayaks to the river anymore. This changed everything. Even my 8 year old can use it! Which he loves.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Eells

customer_reviews.title: On use on lighter weight kayaks
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, left wheel axle bent on First use with a 77 pound kayak. I will modify it to work Instead of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Monk

customer_reviews.title: Poor condition. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with flat tires. For this cost and shipping time I expected more than trying to fix it upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Sara S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for kayakers
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these, one for my mom and one for my two nephews. Works great and makes carrying the kayak much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I did not get to use the cart because it was missing attaching parts but seemed to be a decent cart ! I returned it to seller! They were very helpful in the return process!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective wheel won’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: Came with a defective flat tire. After putting air in it, it wouldn’t hold air. Think it’s defective inner air tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight with sturdy wheels
customer_reviews.text: It’s very portable and lightweight. Sturdy wheels. I haven’t figured out how to properly fasten my fishing kayak which is a little wider, so sometimes it falls off when there are lots of bumps. I’m sure I’m doing it wrong. One nice thing I like is the padding on the bars. I actually use it to put it against the back window (kart is upside down) of my Jeep and roll the kayak up using the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Porras

customer_reviews.title: Makes kayak transportation EASY
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single parent and have a very HEAVY two seater kayak. This made transporting my kayak extremely easy. The large wheels on the dolly enables it to go over multiple types on terrain with easy. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is very sturdy and built well
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy and built well. The wheels make it easy to maneuver the kayaks around. We even stack 2 kayaks together and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect wheel set. easy to get our Kayak's from the campsite to the lake with very little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Tadziu

customer_reviews.title: Item as described
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly and looks easy to assemble! We have not had the opportunity to use it as it is winter here but I am looking forward to being able to move my kayak on my own!
customer_reviews.author: Debra L von Lunz

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: One tire defective straight out of the box and cannot hold air. Tried contacting seller but it was a round and round hassle so decided to return and try another. If the second attempt arrives without defect, I’ll consider changing my review.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought YEARS AGO!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This dolly made getting my new tandem kayak to the water a pleasure instead of the chore my other kayak poses. I will use this every chance I get.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak dolly!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product that's easy to use. I like the fact that I can attach it where I like as opposed to those that fit in the scupper holes. This means I can put another my wife's kayak on top and evenly distributed the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice dolly but you'll need a longer strap!
customer_reviews.text: We have a very nice kayak. It is quite large however and the dolly make it a one hand job to move. The straps provided do not reach completely around the middle of our kayak forcing us to place the dolly under the rear of the kayak where the strap will fit leaving the watercraft unbalanced. Combining both straps provided end to end is the only solution we found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: perfect for getting out on a kayak ride at high tide near my home
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D. Retallack

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is just what I needed to transport my paddle board down to the water
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Labar

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works to transport a kayak but I had to add some eye hooks for the strap as it is difficult to do so without them. A couple of hose clamps with key rings did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Brillon

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Cart Dolly Wheels Trolley
customer_reviews.text: The wheels were just to small to go up and down the flight of stars I have take to the lake
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: a great trolley
customer_reviews.text: It comes assembled except for putting on the wheels, but those don't need tools and take seconds to install. The only possible complaint I could see people having is that it's short, but besides that it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: Rivets are not adequate!
customer_reviews.text: Two of four Rivets holding on the wheel Axel fell out when the item was taken out of the package. Other two could be easily removed with fingers. Replaced them with a thought bolt hopefully the the remaining eight rivets on the product will stay together! Will write other review after the cart has actually been used but so far not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: SaltSeaAir

customer_reviews.title: Great product and seller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend for her birthday and she absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: LAK

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I have a Jackson fishing kayak which weighs approx. 100 lbs. I have been using the cart to haul the kayak 400 yds. every other day for sometime and it pulls fine with no breakage. I did have to Zip tie some foam noodles to the cart to keep the kayak centered. Other than that it was a good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Schraw

customer_reviews.title: THEY ARE NOT AIRLESS TIRES
customer_reviews.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED. It says the tires are airless, which they aren't. They need air. Had I known this I would of never bought this item. I wanted a maintenance free tire.
customer_reviews.author: Dan and Nichole Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Work fantastic on dry pavement
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on dry pavement and very loose sand and even taken it down a small set of stairs with the kayak on it. This is a well designed product. It folds and the wheels come off in a matter of seconds. 100% worth the money if you have a heavy kayak to move around.
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Kossler

customer_reviews.title: Love this dolley
customer_reviews.text: I really like this dolley . It was easy assemble and it helps so much and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Faulty parts they will not acknowledge
customer_reviews.text: Kayak dolly came with a flat tire due to a leak in tire tube. Without proper working tires, the dolly is useless. There is no way to reach the vendor for a replacement part. Repeated efforts to contact vendor have produced zero results. Plans to use this dolly on a vacation are now shot. Do not buy from this vendor unless you want to lose your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to assemble. But the system for strapping my kayak to it is of little use. The strap will not firmly hold a kayak to the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Dana W

customer_reviews.title: Cart works well.
customer_reviews.text: The product works well. I wanted solid tires as depicted, but got pneumatic tires. The seller gave me a partial refund in case I need to buy new tires. The seller was very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: wp

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for job!
customer_reviews.text: Price was right just use different strap with ratchet to hold kayak on cart!👍
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Mellace

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions MISSING!
customer_reviews.text: No assembly instructions included. While ut could eventually be figured out, there were small screws, etc., that came in a bag. Just would have made assembly a straight forward process in lieu if trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price! If you kayak this is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item for my kayak. Parking is somtimes quite a distance from where we can drop the kayak into the water and so this was the perfect solution. Product came on time, was easy to assemble, and works great. Had several other kayakers ask about it also and referred them here. Easy 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Kayak
customer_reviews.text: So perfect to haul my double kayak. Super easy to assemble too.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Persson

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling your kayak!
customer_reviews.text: I’m am a 57 year old woman and I can now handle loading and unloading my 10 foot fishing kayak on my own. Super easy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

product_meta.title: Kayak Cart Dolly Wheels Trolley - Kayaking Accessories Best for Beach Tires Transport Canoe Fishing Jon Boat Carrier Caddy Scupper Carts Trolly Roller Sit on Top Kayaks Wagon Wheel Hauler Tote Rollers
product_meta.description:
Easily transport your kayak using The Universal Kayak Boat Canoe Cart Transportation Carrier from OxGord, a premier manufacturer and supplier of auto and vehicle parts & accessories.

Easy to use: Our trolley is the ultimate transporter to carry your kayak, canoe, or another small boat from your automobile to the river, lake, ocean, or body of water of your choice.

It’s a terrific alternative to portaging, and with its V-shaped cradle, it will perfectly hold the hull of kayaks and canoes. Plus, you won’t have to risk injury by attempting to portage your boat on uneven terrain.

Foldable: Folding the dolly when it’s not in use is a great way to save space while storing it. Plus, you won’t have to use an extra roof rack or hand trailer just to transport the dolly when you’re not using it.

Secure equipment: Just use the cam buckle tie down for securing your boat onto the trolley, and you’ll be maneuvering it across a wide variety of outdoor terrains including grass, pavement, dirt roads, gravel, uneven surfaces, sand, beaches, and even water.

Features:

• Rust-resistant metal 
• Foam cushioned bars 
• Holds up to 165 pounds 
• 10” full rubber wheels 
• Double leg kickstand 
• Cam buckle tie down strap

Warranty: 1-year limited manufacturers warranty.

So stop risking injury by carrying your boat yourself, and use our kayak cart dolly to caddy your aquatic vehicle to the water and back.

Please note that the tires are airless, not pneumatic.

Please feel free to contact us with any questions, comments, or concerns.

Please see other OxGord products to fulfill all of your automotive part & accessory needs.
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: 27"L x 14"W x 18.5"H inches - Securing Strap 144”L x 1”W inches.

CAPACITY: Our kayak dolly can carry up to 165 lbs. and includes a cam buckle tie down strap to secure your kayak, canoe, or another small boat once it’s been placed on top of the trolley. The dolly also features 10” all-terrain airless solid rubber tires for easy rolling along with a double leg kickstand for extra stability and easy loading.
DURABLE: Constructed with corrosion-resistant aluminum and features foam cushion on the bars to protect the kayak or vehicle from bumps, scratches, and other abrasions.

EASY STORAGE: Our kayak dolly folds flat for easy transportation in your car, truck, van, or SUV. When folded, its compact size allows you to save space and to conveniently store the dolly in your garage or shed.
GUARANTEE: Includes a one (1) year limited warranty.
